subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (us-west-2)

messages.content:
Subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (us-west-2)

Automated detection from monitoring system:

The search-api service in the us-west-2 region is experiencing critical issues, resulting in multiple 500 errors. This is likely due to an overload or misconfiguration within the service. The search functionality of the application is affected, preventing all users from performing searches. The issue is recurring, leading to a significant degradation of user experience and potential loss of customer engagement.

Service: search-api
Region: us-west-2
Severity: critical
Event Type: api

Metrics:
{
  "latency_ms": 577.89,
  "status_code": 500,
  "request_size_kb": 7.15
}

Workaround: Currently, there are no effective workarounds. It is recommended to investigate the search-api service for performance bottlenecks or misconfigurations. Review recent changes and consider scaling resources or optimizing queries.

This ticket was auto-generated by the AI monitoring system.

extracted_fields.impact: search functionality of the application is affected, preventing all users from performing searches

merged_extracted_fields.impact: search functionality of the application is affected, preventing all users from performing searches

current_triage.rationale: The ticket describes a critical issue with the search-api service causing multiple 500 errors, affecting all users and leading to significant degradation of user experience.

current_routing.reasoning: Routed to engineering due to outage classification. SLA set based on enterprise tier and P0 priority. Escalated due to P0 critical priority.
